For our model we started with a correlation matrix to see what variables have the highest correlation with Mortality. From the correlation matrix we see that those variables are: LowBirthWT, Income_avg, DietDiversity and ZeroVegtable.

### Linear Model 

```{r echo=FALSE}
#Scatter Plot and Correlation Matrix of all Variables
model_data <- (select(nd_inc_mort_avg, c(2,4,6,7,10,11,12,13,14,15)))
model_data <- na.omit(model_data)
ggpairs(model_data, upper = list(continuous = wrap("points", alpha = 0.3, size=0.1)),
        lower = list(continuous = wrap('cor', size = 4)))
```



```{r echo=FALSE}
model <- lm(model_data$Mortality_avg ~ model_data$LowBirthWT + model_data$DietDiversity + model_data$ZeroVegtable + model_data$MinAcceptDiet + model_data$MinMealFreq)
summary(model)
```


```{r}
step(model, direction = 'both')
```
